page.title: 01Walberton Village
page.content: The main settlement in the block is the village of Walberton with its associated hamlet of Binsted - both in the original Domesday Book. Walberton is situated on the West Sussex coastal plain in the prosperous south of Britain. It is a well-kept, quiet and unspoilt village, helped by being off a main road. It has won the best kept village competition three times in recent years. The surrounding area is mainly agricultural or woodland. It is a very pleasant place to live with many attractions nearby, e.g.the coast, the South Downs, the towns of Arundel and Chichester and Barnham mainline station one mile away. Hence it is a much sought after village with house prices being relatively high for the area.
